text: will the party be voting with the
government's charter for fiscal
responsibility you called it a trap
today I know look I've been in Palm 18
years you know okay I've never seen
anything so surreal as this charter
right this is the this is the chance
Exchequer coming to Parliament to ask
Parliament to pass legislation to tell
him to do what he's going to do already
and when including it is a get out
clause of normal times we're going to
this debate I think it's going to be
farcical and we will saying we will vote
for it on the basis that we want to
assure people that we will tackle the
deficit we will balance the budget will
live with an army I change my mind but I
haven't changed my mind on the
principles of what the Charter is
standing for which is we need to tackle
the deficit and we will tackle it if
that label will tackle the deficit we're
not deficit denies so I haven't changed
my mind on that but I have changed my
mind on the parliamentary tactics
originally what I said to people was
that look this charter as a political
stunt it's a political trap by George
Osborne it's virtually meaningless he
bought himself time and time again he
never meets his targets so this is just
a stunt and let's ridicule it in the
debate and vote vote for it because it's
meaningless vote I went to red car I
went to rekha and I met the steel
workers and I had families in tears
about what's happening to them as a
result the government failing to act
failing to intervene and I came back and
I realized as the consequences of
government's failure to invest in
infrastructure in skills the cuts that
are going to start coming now I realize
that people actually are going to suffer
badly and it brought it home to me and I
don't want the Labour Party associated
with this policy so therefore I decided
I think we should now vote against
completely disassociate ourselves with
